thread.title: Tara Palmer-Tomkinson was the ultimate party animal and friend of the royals who was never free of her demons
thread.title_full: Tara Palmer-Tomkinson was the ultimate party animal and friend of the royals who was never free of her demons

author: Rachael Bletchly
title: Tara Palmer-Tomkinson was the ultimate party animal and friend of the royals who was never free of her demons
text:
Celebrities pay tribute to Tara Palmer-Tomkinson Share this video Watch Next 
Ingrid Seward, editor of Majesty Magazine, said: “She did have it all, and perhaps that was part of her problem. 
“She was a good-looking girl, she had a fabulous family, she was a brilliant skier, rider, and she was very artistic. She sang beautifully. 
“I think there was just too much, and life gave her too many choices, and she just didn’t make the right ones. Tara Palmer-Tomkinson as a Dr No Bond girl Ursula Andress in 1998 (Photo: Rex Features) Tara Palmer-Tomkinson arrives to attend the Royal Wedding of Prince William to Catherine Middleton (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
“But she was a very generous, sweet person.” 
Tara was born in Hampshire on December 23, 1971, the youngest of three children to Charles Palmer-Tomkinson and Argentian-born Patti. Her brother James runs a ski company and sister Santa is a writer. 
Tara said they had a “privileged but normal” childhood. But her family were all high-achievers, with her dad was an Olympic skier. A body bag is taken from Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's house (Photo: Ian Vogler/Daily Mirror) 
Tara said in 2010: “I don’t think anybody in my family really wanted to know about me until I could play Mozart and ski a black run. 
“There was always that understanding that to be a proper P-T you had to be successful. I don’t know what a proper P-T is, but I have a feeling I might not be it.” 
Her dad met Patti when she was a chalet girl in Swiss resort Klosters. Patti was friends with Camilla Shand, now the Duchess of Cornwall, and the couple became pals with the Prince of Wales, who her dad Charles taught to ski when he was 14. Tara Palmer-Tomkinson on The Frank Skinner show (Photo: BBC) Tara Palmer-Tomkinson on Fame Academy (Photo: YouTube/pauldbate) 
Tara remained close to Prince Charles and his sons William and Harry, and attended the wedding of Prince William and Kate Middleton in 2011. 
Tara was 20 when she launched herself on to the London party scene, and became the original Nineties It Girl. But it was also the start of her cocaine addiction. 
“I went to the Oscars and the Baftas,” Tara said. “It was like Christmas every day. The trouble is, it turned into a white Christmas.” Tara Palmer Tomkinson on I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here (Photo: Rex Features) 
She dated celebrities including Simply Red singer Mick Hucknall and Robbie Williams, and was briefly engaged to Greg Martin, son of Beatles producer Sir George, in 1999. 
Prior to that, her cocaine addiction became apparent when she gave a rambling interview to Frank Skinner. 
But going into rehab in 2000 marked a turning point. In 2002 she was runner-up in I’m A Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here! and won over millions of viewers. 
Tara said: “I’m extremely grateful to I’m A Celebrity because I was able to show that I’m a bit eccentric but I’m resilient, too.” 
But just a few years later, Tara was pictured with a collapsed septum in her nose. She insisted it was the legacy of her pre-rehab usage and had surgery in 2006. 
A year later she had another reality TV triumph on Comic Relief Does Fame Academy. Tara had triumphs on reality TV (Photo: Rex Features) 
But on other shows, including Project Catwalk, her behaviour was becoming more erratic and her appearance was more gaunt. Tara had another operation to fix her septum in 2010, but maintained she had not returned to cocaine. 
She later went back into rehab, to treat anxiety and depression. And in 2014, Tara told The Jeremy Kyle Show she was living like a recluse as a result of anxiety. 
The same year she also claimed she had been diagnosed with a form of autism which “could explain why I’ve always lived my life at such a frantic level”. Tara on I'm A Celeb (Photo: Rex Features) 
Tara added: “I was even given Ritalin as a child to make me concentrate. No one could understand why I behaved a certain way.” 
Later in 2014 she was arrested at Heathrow Airport over a fracas when she was refused entry to the first-class lounge. Tara denied claims she was drunk and insisted she had a panic attack. 
Met Police confirmed a woman in her 40s had been found dead at Tara’s address in South Kensington, South West London. A statement added: “Police are not treating the death as suspicious.” Tara with Prince Charles and Denise Van Outen (Photo: Reuters) 
In November, Tara revealed she had tumour in her pituitary gland and a condition where abnormal antibodies attack the body’s cells and tissue. But she said: “I’m 100% determined to get better. 
“I’m like Alice In Wonderland. I fall down the rabbit hole... then, just as I poke my head out the top, I fall back down again. But I will get out.” 
Tragically, Tara never really escaped her own wonderland. Like us on Facebook
